content.description:
Interesting moves, and the variation is also worthwhile. 

  Up the right side of blocks to a wide ledge. Step across to base of a ramp going diagonal Left. Up the ramp, and a bit before its top step Right onto a platform. Up over another platform to the top. 

Variation: When reach the wide platform ... (instead of going to base of ramp) step across to the face above, and see two lines of weakness (or wide irregular grooves perhaps with some corners). Roughly straight up the right line of weakness. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
content.protection:
Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate. 

  For ideas to set up Top-Rope, see the Description of this Fairy Tales sector.
content.location:
At a low wall 8-10 feet high below a wide ledge which is to right from under the wide chimney with a roof.

content.description:
Some interesting moves at the difficulty grade. Too bad it's not longer. 

  Up left side of low blocks to a wide ledge. Then up the face above at the line of weakness (or irregular wide groove with a couple of corners) which is three or four feet right of the left edge of the wide chimney with roof at top.   . . (There are two lines of weakness -- this is the left one). 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Some interesting moves. 

  Start on right center face of the low wall (about five feet left of short vertical crack going up to right-facing corner capped by a little roof). Up that face (without using the crack to the left or crack to right) and up over the pancake rock.    . . (shared with the route Emperor's New Clothes).   Next step across the wide ledge a bit right, and up the (non-bulging) face to the high right section of the higher gentle left-trending ramp. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Lots of fun interesting moves. 

  Directly over the highest point of the low wall, without using footholds to the left or right side. Step across the ledge to the base of the left-trending diagonal ramp. A couple of moves up the ramp, then straight up to and through the left-facing corner above, and finish straight to the top. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Thoughtful moves. 

  Start up low orange steep right-trending ramp, next up to low end of higher gentle ramp trending Left, a short ways on that, then finish straight up left side of top left-facing corner.   Variation easier finish: further Left up the higher gentle ramp before turning straight to the top. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Fun stemming moves, and an interesting (strenuous) exit. 

  Up the center of the wide chimney, near its top move to right side. Finish over the big roof stone, using the tree trunk on its right side.   . . Variation - more like 5.8 if are careful not to use the tree. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Worthwhile climbing. 

  Up the arete, perhaps mostly on its left side. Then bear left and less steep to the top. 

  . . Variation 1 - (about the same difficulty): Start on the face a few feet left of the arete. Join the arete higher up. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

qqq

content.description:
Interesting face climbing with a strenuous crux sequence. 

  Over the left side of the pancake rock, walk left on the wide ledge to base of left-trending diagonal ramp. One step on the ramp and up onto the face above. Aim for roughly-vertial crack a bit right. Up that, then to the top. 

  name? Polish fairy tale - for climbers? 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

  Up along left side of vertical crack and over around left side of cap. Next up to face below higher part of gentle ramp trending left. A little up that face, then right four feet, up onto gentle ramp, then up face to top. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree).

content.description:
Lots of interesting face climbing, but one move much harder than the rest. 

  Start on right center face of the low wall (about five feet left of short vertical crack going up to right-facing corner capped by a little roof). Up that face (without using the crack to the left or crack to right) and up over the pancake rock.    . . (shared with the route Steadfast Tin Soldier).   Step across wide ledge onto stack, then up the bulge roughly straight to the top, finishing a bit left of the top of the left-trending diagonal ramp. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Conquer the right outside corner arete of each the big blocks stacked at the right end of this wall (with some sideways steps to connect them). From top of highest block, up face to reach main arete, and up that to top.

 warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree).

 . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Slab about 30-40 feet tall.    Faces roughly South.   Friendly base area. 

  Top-Rope: One way to get access to set up an anchor using trees above top of this cliff is to scramble up around the right side, with some thoughtful somewhat exposed moves. 

warning: The rock around this sector has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
